H0.text: Air is the medium into which pollutants are released to produce acid rain.

H1.text: Soil is the medium into which pollutants are released, leading to acid rain.

H2.text: Rivers are the result of pollutants being released into the environment that cause acid rain.

H3.text: Oceans are the environment into which pollutants are released, leading to acid rain.

A4.text: Acid rain is caused by emissions of sulfur dioxide and nitrogen oxide, which react with the water molecules in the atmosphere to produce acids.

A5.text: The principal cause of acid rain is sulfur and nitrogen compounds from human sources, such as electricity generation, animal agriculture, factories, and motor vehicles.
